intro: Labillardiera mutabilis, commonly known as the variable labillardiera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with smooth, often glabrous bark and alternate, simple leaves. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing drought tolerance and resilience. The flowers bloom in spring, attracting a variety of pollinators such as bees and birds.
